00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_signed.h -- Arbitrary precision signed arithmetic.
00023 
00024     This file includes the definitions of sc_signed_bitref,
00025     sc_signed_subref, and sc_signed classes. The first two classes are
00026     proxy classes to reference one bit and a range of bits of a
00027     sc_signed number, respectively.
00028 
00029     An sc_signed number has the sign-magnitude representation
00030     internally. However, its interface guarantees a 2's-complement
00031     representation. The sign-magnitude representation is chosen
00032     because of its efficiency: The sc_signed and sc_unsigned types are
00033     optimized for arithmetic rather than bitwise operations. For
00034     arithmetic operations, the sign-magnitude representation performs
00035     better.
00036 
00037     The implementations of sc_signed and sc_unsigned classes are
00038     almost identical: Most of the member and friend functions are
00039     defined in sc_nbcommon.cpp and sc_nbfriends.cpp so that they can
00040     be shared by both of these classes. These functions are chosed by
00041     defining a few macros before including them such as IF_SC_SIGNED
00042     and CLASS_TYPE. Our implementation choices are mostly dictated by
00043     performance considerations in that we tried to provide the most
00044     efficient sc_signed and sc_unsigned types without compromising
00045     their interface.
00046 
00047     For the behavior of operators, we have two semantics: the old and
00048     new. The most important difference between these two semantics is
00049     that the old semantics is closer to C/C++ semantics in that the
00050     result type of a binary operator on unsigned and signed arguments
00051     is unsigned; the new semantics, on the other hand, requires the
00052     result type be signed. The new semantics is required by the VSIA
00053     C/C++ data types standard. We have implemented the new semantics.
00054 
00055   Original Author: Ali Dasdan, Synopsys, Inc.
00056 
00057  *****************************************************************************/
00058 
00059 /*****************************************************************************
00060 
00061   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00062   changes you are making here.
00063 
00064       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00065   Description of Modification:
00066 
00067  *****************************************************************************/

00722 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00723 //  CLASS : sc_signed_bitref_r
00724 //
00725 //  Proxy class for sc_signed bit selection (r-value only).
00726 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00727 
00728 class SC_API sc_signed_bitref_r : public sc_value_base
00729 {
00730     friend class sc_signed;
00731 
00732 protected:
00733 
00734     // constructor
00735 
00736     sc_signed_bitref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_index(0), m_obj_p(0)
00737         {}
00738 
00739     void initialize( const sc_signed* obj_p, int index_ )
00740         {
00741             m_index = index_;
00742             m_obj_p = ( const_cast<sc_signed*>( obj_p ) );
00743         }
00744 
00745 public:
00746 
00747     // destructor
00748 
00749     virtual ~sc_signed_bitref_r()
00750         {}
00751 
00752     // copy constructor
00753 
00754     sc_signed_bitref_r( const sc_signed_bitref_r& a )
00755         : sc_value_base(a), m_index( a.m_index ), m_obj_p( a.m_obj_p )
00756         {}
00757 
00758     // capacity
00759 
00760     int length() const
00761         { return 1; }
00762 
00763 
00764     // implicit conversion to bool
00765 
00766     operator uint64 () const;
00767     bool operator ! () const;
00768     bool operator ~ () const;
00769 
00770 
00771     // explicit conversions
00772 
00773     bool value() const
00774         { return operator uint64(); }
00775 
00776     bool to_bool() const
00777         { return operator uint64(); }
00778 
00779     // concatenation support
00780 
00781     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00782         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return 1; }
00783     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00784         { return (uint64)operator uint64(); }
00785     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00786         {
00787             int  bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00788             int  word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00789             dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00790             return false;
00791         }
00792     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00793         {
00794             int  bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00795             bool result;        // True if non-zero.
00796             int  word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00797             if ( operator uint64() )
00798             {
00799                 dst_p[word_i] |= bit_mask;
00800                 result = true;
00801             }
00802             else
00803             {
00804                 dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00805                 result = false;
00806             }
00807             return result;
00808         }
00809 
00810 
00811     // other methods
00812 
00813     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00814         { os << to_bool(); }
00815 
00816 protected:
00817 
00818     int        m_index;  // Bit to be selected.
00819     sc_signed* m_obj_p;  // Target of this bit selection.
00820 
00821 private:
00822 
00823     // disabled
00824     const sc_signed_bitref_r& operator = ( const sc_signed_bitref_r& );
00825 };
00826 
00827 
00828 
00829 inline
00830 ::std::ostream&
00831 operator << ( ::std::ostream&, const sc_signed_bitref_r& );
00832

00834 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00835 //  CLASS : sc_signed_bitref
00836 //
00837 //  Proxy class for sc_signed bit selection (r-value and l-value).
00838 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00839 
00840 class SC_API sc_signed_bitref
00841     : public sc_signed_bitref_r
00842 {
00843     friend class sc_signed;
00844     friend class sc_core::sc_vpool<sc_signed_bitref>;
00845 
00846 
00847     // constructor
00848 
00849 protected:
00850 
00851     sc_signed_bitref() : sc_signed_bitref_r()
00852         {}
00853 
00854 public:
00855 
00856     // copy constructor
00857 
00858     sc_signed_bitref( const sc_signed_bitref& a )
00859         : sc_signed_bitref_r( a )
00860         {}
00861 
00862     // assignment operators
00863 
00864     const sc_signed_bitref& operator = ( const sc_signed_bitref_r& );
00865     const sc_signed_bitref& operator = ( const sc_signed_bitref& );
00866     const sc_signed_bitref& operator = ( bool );
00867 
00868     const sc_signed_bitref& operator &= ( bool );
00869     const sc_signed_bitref& operator |= ( bool );
00870     const sc_signed_bitref& operator ^= ( bool );
00871 
00872     // concatenation methods
00873 
00874     virtual void concat_set(int64 src, int low_i);
00875     virtual void concat_set(const sc_signed& src, int low_i);
00876     virtual void concat_set(const sc_unsigned& src, int low_i);
00877     virtual void concat_set(uint64 src, int low_i);
00878 
00879 
00880     // other methods
00881 
00882     void scan( ::std::istream& is = ::std::cin );
00883 
00884 protected:
00885     static sc_core::sc_vpool<sc_signed_bitref> m_pool;
00886 };

00895 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00896 //  CLASS : sc_signed_subref_r
00897 //
00898 //  Proxy class for sc_signed part selection (r-value only).
00899 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00900 
00901 class SC_API sc_signed_subref_r : public sc_value_base
00902 {
00903     friend class sc_signed;
00904     friend class sc_signed_signal;
00905     friend class sc_unsigned;
00906 
00907 protected:
00908 
00909     // constructor
00910 
00911     sc_signed_subref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_left(0), m_obj_p(0), m_right(0)
00912         {}
00913 
00914     void initialize( const sc_signed* obj_p, int left_, int right_ )
00915         {
00916             m_obj_p = ( const_cast<sc_signed*>( obj_p ));
00917             m_left = left_;
00918             m_right = right_;
00919         }
00920 
00921 
00922 public:
00923 
00924     // destructor
00925 
00926     virtual ~sc_signed_subref_r()
00927         {}
00928 
00929     // copy constructor
00930 
00931     sc_signed_subref_r( const sc_signed_subref_r& a )
00932         : sc_value_base(a), m_left( a.m_left ), m_obj_p( a.m_obj_p ),
00933           m_right( a.m_right )
00934         {}
00935 
00936 
00937     // capacity
00938 
00939     int length() const
00940         { return m_left >= m_right ? (m_left-m_right+1) : (m_right-m_left+1 ); }
00941 
00942 
00943     // implicit conversion to sc_unsigned
00944 
00945     operator sc_unsigned () const;
00946 
00947 
00948     // explicit conversions
00949 
00950     int           to_int() const;
00951     unsigned int  to_uint() const;
00952     long          to_long() const;
00953     unsigned long to_ulong() const;
00954     int64         to_int64() const;
00955     uint64        to_uint64() const;
00956     double        to_double() const;
00957 
00958 
00959     // explicit conversion to character string
00960 
00961     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const;
00962     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const;
00963 
00964     // concatenation support
00965 
00966     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00967         {
00968             if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false;
00969             return m_left - m_right + 1;
00970         }
00971     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const;
00972     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00973     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00974 
00975     // reduce methods
00976 
00977     bool and_reduce() const;
00978     bool nand_reduce() const;
00979     bool or_reduce() const;
00980     bool nor_reduce() const;
00981     bool xor_reduce() const ;
00982     bool xnor_reduce() const;
00983 
00984 
00985     // other methods
00986 
00987     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00988         { os << to_string(sc_io_base(os,SC_DEC),sc_io_show_base(os)); }
00989 
00990 protected:
00991 
00992     int        m_left;   // Left-most bit in this part selection.
00993     sc_signed* m_obj_p;  // Target of this part selection.
00994     int        m_right;  // Right-most bit in this part selection.
00995 
00996 private:
00997     const sc_signed_subref_r& operator = ( const sc_signed_subref_r& );
00998 
00999 };
01000 
01001 
01002 
01003 inline
01004 ::std::ostream&
01005 operator << ( ::std::ostream&, const sc_signed_subref_r& );
01006

01008 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01009 //  CLASS : sc_signed_subref
01010 //
01011 //  Proxy class for sc_signed part selection (r-value and l-value).
01012 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01013 
01014 class SC_API sc_signed_subref
01015     : public sc_signed_subref_r
01016 {
01017     friend class sc_signed;
01018     friend class sc_core::sc_vpool<sc_signed_subref>;
01019 
01020 
01021     // constructor
01022 
01023     sc_signed_subref() : sc_signed_subref_r()
01024         {}
01025 
01026 public:
01027 
01028     // copy constructor
01029 
01030     sc_signed_subref( const sc_signed_subref& a )
01031         : sc_signed_subref_r( a )
01032         {}
01033 
01034 
01035     // assignment operators
01036 
01037     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_signed_subref_r& a );
01038     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_signed_subref& a );
01039     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_signed& a );
01040 
01041     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_unsigned_subref_r& a );
01042     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_unsigned& a );
01043 
01044     template< class T >
01045     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
01046     {
01047         sc_unsigned temp( length() );
01048         a->to_sc_unsigned(temp);
01049         return operator = (temp);
01050     }
01051 
01052     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const char* a );
01053     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( unsigned long a );
01054     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( long a );
01055     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( unsigned int a )
01056         { return operator = ( (unsigned long) a ); }
01057 
01058     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( int a )
01059         { return operator = ( (long) a ); }
01060 
01061     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( uint64 a );
01062     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( int64 a );
01063     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( double a );
01064     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_int_base& a );
01065     const sc_signed_subref& operator = ( const sc_uint_base& a );
01066 
01067     // concatenation methods
01068 
01069     virtual void concat_set(int64 src, int low_i);
01070     virtual void concat_set(const sc_signed& src, int low_i);
01071     virtual void concat_set(const sc_unsigned& src, int low_i);
01072     virtual void concat_set(uint64 src, int low_i);
01073 
01074     // other methods
01075 
01076     void scan( ::std::istream& is = ::std::cin );
01077 
01078 protected:
01079     static sc_core::sc_vpool<sc_signed_subref> m_pool;
01080 };
01081

01084 inline
01085 ::std::istream&
01086 operator >> ( ::std::istream&, sc_signed_subref& );

01089 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01090 //  CLASS : sc_signed
01091 //
01092 //  Arbitrary precision signed number.
01093 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01094 
01095 class SC_API sc_signed : public sc_value_base
01096 {
01097     friend class sc_concatref;
01098     friend class sc_signed_bitref_r;
01099     friend class sc_signed_bitref;
01100     friend class sc_signed_subref_r;
01101     friend class sc_signed_subref;
01102     friend class sc_unsigned;
01103     friend class sc_unsigned_subref;
01104 
01105     // Needed for types using sc_signed.
01106     typedef bool elemtype;
01107 
01108     void invalid_init( const char* type_name, int nb ) const;
01109 
01110 public:
01111 
01112     // constructors
01113 
01114     explicit sc_signed( int nb = sc_length_param().len() );
01115     sc_signed( const sc_signed&   v );
01116     sc_signed( const sc_unsigned& v );
01117     template<class T>
01118     explicit sc_signed( const sc_generic_base<T>& v );
01119     explicit sc_signed( const sc_bv_base& v );
01120     explicit sc_signed( const sc_lv_base& v );
01121     explicit sc_signed( const sc_int_subref_r& v );
01122     explicit sc_signed( const sc_uint_subref_r& v );
01123     explicit sc_signed( const sc_signed_subref_r& v );
01124     explicit sc_signed( const sc_unsigned_subref_r& v );
01125 
01126     // assignment operators
01127 
01128     const sc_signed& operator = (const sc_signed&          v);
01129     const sc_signed& operator = (const sc_signed_subref_r& a );
01130 
01131     template< class T >
01132     const sc_signed& operator = ( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
01133         { a->to_sc_signed(*this); return *this; }
01134 
01135     const sc_signed& operator = (const sc_unsigned&        v);
01136     const sc_signed& operator = (const sc_unsigned_subref_r& a );
01137 
01138     const sc_signed& operator = (const char*               v);
01139     const sc_signed& operator = (int64                     v);
01140     const sc_signed& operator = (uint64                    v);
01141     const sc_signed& operator = (long                      v);
01142     const sc_signed& operator = (unsigned long             v);
01143 
01144     const sc_signed& operator = (int                       v)
01145         { return operator=((long) v); }
01146 
01147     const sc_signed& operator = (unsigned int              v)
01148         { return operator=((unsigned long) v); }
01149 
01150     const sc_signed& operator = (double                    v);
01151     const sc_signed& operator = (const sc_int_base&        v);
01152     const sc_signed& operator = (const sc_uint_base&       v);
01153 
01154     const sc_signed& operator = ( const sc_bv_base& );
01155     const sc_signed& operator = ( const sc_lv_base& );
01156 
01157 #ifdef SC_INCLUDE_FX
01158     const sc_signed& operator = ( const sc_fxval& );
01159     const sc_signed& operator = ( const sc_fxval_fast& );
01160     const sc_signed& operator = ( const sc_fxnum& );
01161     const sc_signed& operator = ( const sc_fxnum_fast& );
01162 #endif
01163 
01164 
01165     // destructor
01166 
01167     virtual ~sc_signed()
01168         {
01169 #ifndef SC_MAX_NBITS
01170             delete [] digit;
01171 #endif
01172         }
01173 
01174     // Concatenation support:
01175 
01176     sc_digit* get_raw() const
01177         { return digit; }
01178     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
01179         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return nbits; }
01180     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
01181     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
01182     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const;
01183     virtual void concat_set(int64 src, int low_i);
01184     virtual void concat_set(const sc_signed& src, int low_i);
01185     virtual void concat_set(const sc_unsigned& src, int low_i);
01186     virtual void concat_set(uint64 src, int low_i);
01187 
01188 
01189 
01190     // Increment operators.
01191     sc_signed& operator ++ ();
01192     const sc_signed operator ++ (int);
01193 
01194     // Decrement operators.
01195     sc_signed& operator -- ();
01196     const sc_signed operator -- (int);
01197 
01198 
01199     // bit selection
01200 
01201     inline void check_index( int i ) const
01202         { if ( i < 0 || i >= nbits ) invalid_index(i); }
01203 
01204     void invalid_index( int i ) const;
01205 
01206     sc_signed_bitref& operator [] ( int i )
01207         {
01208             check_index(i);
01209             sc_signed_bitref* result_p =
01210                 sc_signed_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01211             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01212             return *result_p;
01213         }
01214 
01215     const sc_signed_bitref_r& operator [] ( int i ) const
01216         {
01217             check_index(i);
01218             sc_signed_bitref* result_p =
01219                 sc_signed_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01220             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01221             return *result_p;
01222         }
01223 
01224     sc_signed_bitref& bit( int i )
01225         {
01226             check_index(i);
01227             sc_signed_bitref* result_p =
01228                 sc_signed_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01229             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01230             return *result_p;
01231         }
01232 
01233     const sc_signed_bitref_r& bit( int i ) const
01234         {
01235             check_index(i);
01236             sc_signed_bitref* result_p =
01237                 sc_signed_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01238             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01239             return *result_p;
01240         }
01241 
01242 
01243     // part selection
01244 
01245     // Subref operators. Help access the range of bits from the ith to
01246     // jth. These indices have arbitrary precedence with respect to each
01247     // other, i.e., we can have i <= j or i > j. Note the equivalence
01248     // between range(i, j) and operator(i, j). Also note that
01249     // operator(i, i) returns a signed number that corresponds to the
01250     // bit operator[i], so these two forms are not the same.
01251 
01252     inline void check_range( int l, int r ) const
01253         {
01254             if ( l < r )
01255             {
01256                 if ( l < 0 || r >= nbits ) invalid_range(l,r);
01257             }
01258             else
01259             {
01260                 if ( r < 0 || l >= nbits ) invalid_range(l,r);
01261             }
01262         }
01263 
01264     void invalid_range( int l, int r ) const;
01265 
01266     sc_signed_subref& range( int i, int j )
01267         {
01268             check_range( i, j );
01269             sc_signed_subref* result_p =
01270                 sc_signed_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01271             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01272             return *result_p;
01273         }
01274 
01275     const sc_signed_subref_r& range( int i, int j ) const
01276         {
01277             check_range( i, j );
01278             sc_signed_subref* result_p =
01279                 sc_signed_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01280             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01281             return *result_p;
01282         }
01283 
01284     sc_signed_subref& operator () ( int i, int j )
01285         {
01286             check_range( i, j );
01287             sc_signed_subref* result_p =
01288                 sc_signed_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01289             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01290             return *result_p;
01291         }
01292 
01293     const sc_signed_subref_r& operator () ( int i, int j ) const
01294         {
01295             check_range( i, j );
01296             sc_signed_subref* result_p =
01297                 sc_signed_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01298             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01299             return *result_p;
01300         }
01301 
01302 
01303     // explicit conversions
01304 
01305     int           to_int() const;
01306     unsigned int  to_uint() const;
01307     long          to_long() const;
01308     unsigned long to_ulong() const;
01309     int64         to_int64() const;
01310     uint64        to_uint64() const;
01311     double        to_double() const;
01312 
01313 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
01314     int to_signed() const
01315         { return to_int(); }
01316 
01317     unsigned int to_unsigned() const
01318         { return to_uint(); }
01319 #endif
01320 
01321     // explicit conversion to character string
01322 
01323     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const;
01324     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const;
01325 
01326 
01327     // Print functions. dump prints the internals of the class.
01328 
01329     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
01330         { os << to_string(sc_io_base(os,SC_DEC),sc_io_show_base(os)); }
01331 
01332     void scan( ::std::istream& is = ::std::cin );
01333 
01334     void dump( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const;
01335 
01336 
01337   // Functions to find various properties.
01338   int  length() const { return nbits; }  // Bit width.
01339   bool iszero() const;                   // Is the number zero?
01340   bool sign() const;                     // Sign.
01341 
01342    // reduce methods
01343 
01344     bool and_reduce() const;
01345 
01346     bool nand_reduce() const
01347         { return ( ! and_reduce() ); }
01348 
01349     bool or_reduce() const;
01350 
01351     bool nor_reduce() const
01352         { return ( ! or_reduce() ); }
01353 
01354     bool xor_reduce() const;
01355 
01356     bool xnor_reduce() const
01357         { return ( ! xor_reduce() ); }
01358 
01359   // Functions to access individual bits.
01360   bool test(int i) const;      // Is the ith bit 0 or 1?
01361   void set(int i);             // Set the ith bit to 1.
01362   void clear(int i);           // Set the ith bit to 0.
01363   void set(int i, bool v)      // Set the ith bit to v.
01364     { if (v) set(i); else clear(i);  }
01365   void invert(int i)           // Negate the ith bit.
01366     { if (test(i)) clear(i); else set(i);  }
01367 
01368   // Make the number equal to its mirror image.
01369   void reverse();
01370 
01371   // Get/set a packed bit representation of the number.
01372   void get_packed_rep(sc_digit *buf) const;
01373   void set_packed_rep(sc_digit *buf);
01374 
01375   /*
01376     The comparison of the old and new semantics are as follows:
01377 
01378     Let s = sc_signed,
01379         u = sc_unsigned,
01380         un = { uint64, unsigned long, unsigned int },
01381         sn = { int64, long, int, char* }, and
01382         OP = { +, -, *, /, % }.
01383 
01384     Old semantics:                     New semantics:
01385       u OP u -> u                        u OP u -> u
01386       s OP u -> u                        s OP u -> s
01387       u OP s -> u                        u OP s -> s
01388       s OP s -> s                        s OP s -> s
01389 
01390       u OP un = un OP u -> u             u OP un = un OP u -> u
01391       u OP sn = sn OP u -> u             u OP sn = sn OP u -> s
01392 
01393       s OP un = un OP s -> s             s OP un = un OP s -> s
01394       s OP sn = sn OP s -> s             s OP sn = sn OP s -> s
01395 
01396     In the new semantics, the result is u if both operands are u; the
01397     result is s otherwise. The only exception is subtraction. The result
01398     of a subtraction is always s.
01399 
01400     The old semantics is like C/C++ semantics on integer types; the
01401     new semantics is due to the VSIA C/C++ data types standard.
01402    */
01403 
01404   // ARITHMETIC OPERATORS:
01405 
01406   // ADDition operators:
01407 
01408   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_unsigned&  u, const sc_signed&    v);
01409   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_signed&    u, const sc_unsigned&  v);
01410 
01411   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_unsigned&  u, int64               v);
01412   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_unsigned&  u, long                v);
01413   friend sc_signed operator + (const sc_unsigned&  u, int                 v)
01414     { return operator+(u, (long) v); }
01415 
01416   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (int64               u, const sc_unsigned&  v);
01417   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (long                u, const sc_unsigned&  v);

01419     { return operator+((long) u, v); }
01420 
01421   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_signed&    u, const sc_signed&    v);
01422   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_signed&    u, int64               v);
01423   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_signed&    u, uint64              v);
01424   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_signed&    u, long                v);
01425   friend SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_signed&    u, unsigned long       v);
01426   friend sc_signed operator + (const sc_signed&    u, int                 v)
01427     { return operator+(u, (long) v); }

01429     { return operator+(u, (unsigned long) v); }

01435   friend sc_signed operator + (int                 u, const sc_signed&    v)

02169 private:
02170 
02171   small_type  sgn;         // Shortened as s.
02172   int nbits;       // Shortened as nb.
02173   int ndigits;     // Shortened as nd.
02174 
02175 #ifdef SC_MAX_NBITS
02176   sc_digit digit[DIV_CEIL(SC_MAX_NBITS)];   // Shortened as d.
02177 #else
02178   sc_digit *digit;                       // Shortened as d.
02179 #endif
02180 
02181   // Private constructors:
02182 
02183   // Create a copy of v with sign s.
02184   sc_signed(const sc_signed&   v, small_type s);
02185   sc_signed(const sc_unsigned& v, small_type s);
02186 
02187   // Create a signed number with the given attributes.
02188   sc_signed(small_type s, int nb, int nd,
02189             sc_digit *d, bool alloc = true);
02190 
02191   // Create an unsigned number using the bits u[l..r].
02192   sc_signed(const sc_signed* u, int l, int r);
02193   sc_signed(const sc_unsigned* u, int l, int r);
02194 
02195   // Private member functions. The called functions are inline functions.
02196 
02197   small_type default_sign() const
02198     { return SC_NOSIGN; }
02199 
02200   int num_bits(int nb) const { return nb; }
02201 
02202   bool check_if_outside(int bit_num) const;
02203 
02204   void copy_digits(int nb, int nd, const sc_digit *d)
02205     { copy_digits_signed(sgn, nbits, ndigits, digit, nb, nd, d); }
02206 
02207   void makezero()
02208     { sgn = make_zero(ndigits, digit); }
02209 
02210   // Conversion functions between 2's complement (2C) and
02211   // sign-magnitude (SM):
02212   void convert_2C_to_SM()
02213     { sgn = convert_signed_2C_to_SM(nbits, ndigits, digit); }
02214 
02215   void convert_SM_to_2C_to_SM()
02216     { sgn = convert_signed_SM_to_2C_to_SM(sgn, nbits, ndigits, digit); }
02217 
02218   void convert_SM_to_2C()
02219     { convert_signed_SM_to_2C(sgn, ndigits, digit); }
02220 
02221 };

02252 
02253 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02254 //  CLASS : sc_signed_subref_r
02255 //
02256 //  Proxy class for sc_signed part selection (r-value only).
02257 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02258 
02259 
02260 // reduce methods
02261 
02262 inline bool sc_signed_subref_r::and_reduce() const
02263 {
02264    const sc_signed* target_p = m_obj_p;
02265    for ( int i = m_right; i <= m_left; i++ )
02266         if ( !target_p->test(i) ) return false;
02267    return true;
02268 }
02269 
02270 inline bool sc_signed_subref_r::nand_reduce() const
02271 {
02272     return !and_reduce();
02273 }
02274 
02275 inline bool sc_signed_subref_r::or_reduce() const
02276 {
02277    const sc_signed* target_p = m_obj_p;
02278    for ( int i = m_right; i <= m_left; i++ )
02279         if ( target_p->test(i) ) return true;
02280    return false;
02281 }
02282 
02283 inline bool sc_signed_subref_r::nor_reduce() const
02284 {
02285     return !or_reduce();
02286 }
02287 
02288 inline bool sc_signed_subref_r::xor_reduce() const
02289 {
02290    int                odd;
02291    const sc_signed* target_p = m_obj_p;
02292    odd = 0;
02293    for ( int i = m_right; i <= m_left; i++ )
02294         if ( target_p->test(i) ) odd = ~odd;
02295    return odd ? true : false;
02296 }
02297 
02298 inline bool sc_signed_subref_r::xnor_reduce() const
02299 {
02300     return !xor_reduce();
02301 }
02302 
02303 inline
02304 ::std::ostream&
02305 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_signed_subref_r& a )
02306 {
02307     a.print( os );
02308     return os;
02309 }

02322 sc_signed_subref::operator = ( const char* a )
02323 {
02324     sc_signed aa( length() );
02325     return ( *this = aa = a );
02326 }

02339 
02340 
02341 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02342 //  CLASS : sc_signed
02343 //
02344 //  Arbitrary precision signed number.
02345 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02346 
02347 template<class T>
02348 sc_signed::sc_signed( const sc_generic_base<T>& v )
02349 {
02350     int nb = v->length();
02351     sgn = default_sign();
02352     if( nb > 0 ) {
02353         nbits = num_bits( nb );
02354     } else {
02355         invalid_init( "sc_generic_base<T>", nb );
02356         sc_core::sc_abort(); // can't recover from here
02357     }
02358     ndigits = DIV_CEIL(nbits);
02359 #   ifdef SC_MAX_NBITS
02360         test_bound(nb);
02361 #    else
02362         digit = new sc_digit[ndigits];
02363 #    endif
02364     makezero();
02365     v->to_sc_signed(*this);
02366 }
02367 
02368 
02369 
02370 inline
02371 ::std::ostream&
02372 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_signed& a )
02373 {
02374     a.print( os );
02375     return os;
02376 }
02377 
02378 inline
02379 ::std::istream&
02380 operator >> ( ::std::istream& is, sc_signed& a )
02381 {
02382     a.scan( is );
02383     return is;
02384 }
